entry.title: digg digest 12/10/07
entry.content:
So I decided to digest interesting links on digg for those you that are uneducated in the ways of social browsing. Here are a list of the random / funny / interesting links of the day:

  1. Why I Got Fired --Â  A series of disastrous pictures (scroll in the small subframe).
  2. The $0 Bill -- A comment on our dear Mr. President's ability to devalue the dollar.
  3. Neurology Review -- A great 30 minute overview of some interesting frontiers of Neurology. It's accurate and very understandable to the public. Too bad real clinical neurology is not nearly as interesting...
  4. Easter Eggs in Pixar Films -- An incredible list of Easter Eggs found in Pixar films.
  5. Color Picking Tools -- Ever needed a tool to help you match colors?

entry.title: i know, i know, im a geek
entry.content: It's too bad not enough people can understand how brilliant these two comics from xkcd are.

entry.title: interview tactics
entry.content:
I ran across this article on my Digg-infested Google Reader. Interestingly, I think it aptly applies to medical school interviews and residency interviews. There's something about that intimidating exchange between two human beings that makes life so miserable for thirty minutes.

http://www.wisebread.com/how-to-answer-23-of-the-most-common-interview-questions

Obvious, yet interesting insights.
